blog.name: phoenixx1018
blog.title: You know, you can be a little annoying sometimes?
blog.description: She/her, Ravenclaw. Fanfic I guess, current obsession is Tyrus. AO3 is Phoenix1018. If you want to be friends, my inbox is always open :) main is @pot-chocolate-05

summary:
Andi mack as things my friends have said the sequel
(Featuring gay Walker because that's apparently a hc now so imma just role...
body:
Andi mack as things my friends have said the sequel

(Featuring gay Walker because that’s apparently a hc now so imma just role with it)

***

Andi: Buffy, I think TJ is touching your bucket.

Buffy: WHAT?!

Buffy: *looks at TJ*

Buffy: TJ, dont touch my bucket, BITCH!

***

Buffy, playing smash bros: Ah, Isabelle, you SKANK! Why are you fishing? Fishing for compliments, cause you’re UGLY!

Cyrus: you… you okay, Buffy?

Buffy, muttering: I lost to a freaking dog.

***

Amber: TJ, I swear to god, I’m gonna yeet you.

TJ: what? No! CYRUS, HELP, AMBER’S GONNA YEET ME!

***

Buffy: I just heard Walker say my name while talking to the choir director…

Cyrus: Ooh, what if he’s planning to serenade you?

Buffy: oh God, I hope not.

TJ: if he does, at the end you should just say really loudly, “I THOUGHT YOU WERE GAY!”

***

TJ: Ooh, Buffy’s sitting with Martyyyy -

Buffy, death glaring: shut up.

TJ: yeah, I guess you’re right. You know, since Walker likes you and everything.

Buffy: He’s literally GAY!

***

Buffy: Wait, Kira’s absent today?

Buffy: Oh. That explains why I dont have a headache yet.

***

Cyrus: Yes! I got straight As on my report card! Did you, TJ?

TJ: Nah, that shit’s homophobic. I got gay As.

blog.name: antimack
blog.title: Underdog
blog.description: Anthony / 18 / He, him / Gay / major Tyrus fan / hopeless romantic

summary:
I am listening to I Won’t by JoJo and these lyrics remind me of Tyrus.
“Love me now, don't tell me that you don't know how
And...
body:
I am listening to I Won’t by JoJo and these lyrics remind me of Tyrus.

“Love me now, don’t tell me that you don’t know how

And right before he turns around, he says

He said I would if I could, but I can’t

He said I would if I did, but I don’t

He said I would if I was, but I’m not, no

He said I would if I would, but I won’t

I won’t, no”

summary: It’s Always Been You
title: It’s Always Been You
body:
A short fic that is in no way related to 3x13, but is very fluffy.

–

2, 5, 8, 10, 12, 14, 17, the points were racking up. The other team stared in awe as TJ sunk another three-pointer. He had no idea where all this energy was coming from, but this was hands down the best TJ had ever played. With six seconds left on the clock and a twelve point lead, TJ stole the ball from the opposing team and shot his final shot at the three-point line.

SWISH!

The buzzer goes off as the ball falls through the hoop. His team surrounds him, clapping him on the back as he releases the breath he didn’t realize he was holding. He shakes the other players’ hands and walks over to the bench to grab his stuff. The coach compliments him and informs them that there would be no practice tomorrow in honor of the win. Finally, TJ turns towards the stands to search for Cyrus, but he’s already standing in front of him, giving him a giant smile and holding one of his signature signs.

“That was awesome, Teej”, the younger boy exclaimed, hugging him fiercely. Even though he had just played what felt like the longest game of his life, TJ was invigorated by his crush’s touch and eagerly returned the embrace.

“Thanks, Underdog”, the basketball player replied as the pair broke apart. “I’m going to go change. Meet you outside in a bit?” The brunet nodded and TJ headed off towards the locker room.

The rest of the team was already in there and cheers went up when TJ came in. They all offered forms of congratulations as he went down the isles to his locker. James, the shooting guard now that Buffy had her own team, leaned up against his locker, already changed, when he saw TJ walking up.

“G.G. Kippen”, he said watching TJ fiddle with his locker combination.

“Thanks”, he responded as his locker swung open, glancing slightly at the other boy. “You, too.”

James was silent for a minute before he said, “You know your friend that’s always with you? The one you beat up Alex for when he said stuff about him?”

“Yes?”, TJ answered tensing. He remembered vividly what he had beaten up the school’s football star for.

“The other team’s captain kept looking at him. He kept getting distracted whenever he would cheer or anything.” TJ took a second to digest this information before turning toward the other boy. James was watching the captain, trying to gauge his reaction. “Just thought you should know”, the boy added.

TJ nodded and thanked him before heading to the showers, the information he had just learned occupying all of his thoughts. There were plenty of reasons why he could’ve been looking at Cyrus, he thought, he is pretty loud when it comes to cheering. But TJ knew the only reason why the other captain would be so distracted by Cyrus would be the same reasons he’s usually distracted by Cyrus. Because Cyrus is cute and he’s a raging homosexual.

TJ was showered and changed in ten minutes. He left the locker room at a quicker pace than normal. He pretended that it was to make sure Cyrus didn’t have to wait long, but he knew the main reason was to make sure the other captain didn’t try anything. Like asking him out in a polite and pleasant way. But when he reached the hall, he realized he was too late. Cyrus and the other player stood talking at the end of the corridor. The other team probably should’ve left already, but apparently, cute, quirky boys were a good reason to delay the trip back.

TJ slowly walked up to the pair, trying to act nonchalant, an expression he’d gotten pretty good at over the years of terrifying everyone in a thousand-foot radius. Except for Cyrus. And small children. And animals, surprisingly. Oh, and don’t forget his used-to-be nemesis, Buffy Driscoll. Plus, his sister. Oh, and-

“Teej!”, Cyrus excited call broke through the boy’s train of thought. TJ beamed at the smaller boy and was pleasantly surprised when Cyrus rushed over to him, leaving the other captain looking rather disappointed.

“Hey, Cy. Ready to go?”, TJ asked as he glanced at the other boy watching them. Before, the brown-eyed boy could answer, however, another voice interjected.

“Good game, Kippen”, the other captain said coming up to the two friends. The boy was about TJ’s height, but a bit skinnier, with brown hair and blue eyes freckles dotting his face. He was cute, in TJ’s professional gay opinion. Probably Cyrus’s type.

“Thanks, Marias”, the boy’s last name coming back to TJ. “Same for you.” Marais gave TJ a look. They both knew he hadn’t been playing his best. And they both knew the reason why. They tried to stare each other down for a bit before Marais turned toward the smaller boy who was looking between the two players.

“It was nice meeting you Cyrus”, he said. 

Cyrus smiled, “It was nice meeting you, too.”

The other captain nodded, realizing he had lost his chance at the boy as soon as TJ walked up. He nodded at TJ in one final acknowledgment before heading off, presumably towards his bus. The pair watched him leave before turning back toward each other. Now that he and Cyrus were alone, TJ visibly relaxed. He gave Cyrus a big smile before throwing his arm over the brunet’s shoulders. 

“So, milkshakes at the spoon?”, he asked. Cyrus beamed and nodded his head as they walked out of the school together.

—

When they were happily situated on their respective sides of a booth and had their customary basket of baby taters and milkshakes, TJ decided to address the thing that had been eating at him.

“So”, he began, stretching out and leaning back to make it seem like he wasn’t that interested. “What did Marais want?”

“Oh, he asked me out”, Cyrus answered, nonchalantly. If TJ had been drinking his milkshake, he would’ve choked.

“What?”, he asked in a strained voice.

“Yeah, he came up to me and said I was cute, and then he asked me out. What is it so strange that someone would want to go out with me?”, Cyrus said.

“No, I’m sure there are plenty of guys who want to ask you out”, TJ responded honestly. Me included, he thought. “It’s just–you didn’t say anything about going out with him.”

“I’m not. I said ‘no’.”

“You did? Why?”, TJ blanched. 

“I don’t like him like that. I like someone else”, Cyrus said, slightly nervous.

“Oh”, TJ replied, disappointed once again. “Who’s the lucky guy?”

Cyrus was quiet for a minute before taking a deep breath and looking up at TJ. “You.”

TJ sat shock still for a minute before his face broke out into the biggest smile his face could physically conjure up. “Me?”, he asked. Cyrus nodded, a small smile growing on his face. At this, TJ slid over to the other side of the booth and cupping the smaller boys face in his hands. He closed the distance between them and placed a soft kiss on the boy’s lips. When they pulled apart, they both wore huge grins.

“So, am I the person you like?”, Cyrus asked, teasing.

But TJ just nodded and seriously said, “It’s always been you, Underdog.” At this, Cyrus pulled him back into another small kiss.

The next time they played that team, Jefferson won 47-5. TJ celebrated by kissing his boyfriend.

When they pulled apart, they both wore huge grins.

“So, am I the person you like?”, Cyrus asked, teasing.

But TJ just nodded and seriously said, “It’s always been you, Underdog.” At this, Cyrus pulled him back into another small kiss.

The next time they played that team, Jefferson won 47-5. TJ celebrated by kissing his boyfriend.

trail.content_raw:
A short fic that is in no way related to 3x13, but is very fluffy.

–

2, 5, 8, 10, 12, 14, 17, the points were racking up. The other team stared in awe as TJ sunk another three-pointer. He had no idea where all this energy was coming from, but this was hands down the best TJ had ever played. With six seconds left on the clock and a twelve point lead, TJ stole the ball from the opposing team and shot his final shot at the three-point line.

SWISH!

The buzzer goes off as the ball falls through the hoop. His team surrounds him, clapping him on the back as he releases the breath he didn’t realize he was holding. He shakes the other players’ hands and walks over to the bench to grab his stuff. The coach compliments him and informs them that there would be no practice tomorrow in honor of the win. Finally, TJ turns towards the stands to search for Cyrus, but he’s already standing in front of him, giving him a giant smile and holding one of his signature signs.

“That was awesome, Teej”, the younger boy exclaimed, hugging him fiercely. Even though he had just played what felt like the longest game of his life, TJ was invigorated by his crush’s touch and eagerly returned the embrace.

“Thanks, Underdog”, the basketball player replied as the pair broke apart. “I’m going to go change. Meet you outside in a bit?” The brunet nodded and TJ headed off towards the locker room.

The rest of the team was already in there and cheers went up when TJ came in. They all offered forms of congratulations as he went down the isles to his locker. James, the shooting guard now that Buffy had her own team, leaned up against his locker, already changed, when he saw TJ walking up.

“G.G. Kippen”, he said watching TJ fiddle with his locker combination.

“Thanks”, he responded as his locker swung open, glancing slightly at the other boy. “You, too.”

James was silent for a minute before he said, “You know your friend that’s always with you? The one you beat up Alex for when he said stuff about him?”

“Yes?”, TJ answered tensing. He remembered vividly what he had beaten up the school’s football star for.

“The other team’s captain kept looking at him. He kept getting distracted whenever he would cheer or anything.” TJ took a second to digest this information before turning toward the other boy. James was watching the captain, trying to gauge his reaction. “Just thought you should know”, the boy added.

TJ nodded and thanked him before heading to the showers, the information he had just learned occupying all of his thoughts. There were plenty of reasons why he could’ve been looking at Cyrus, he thought, he is pretty loud when it comes to cheering. But TJ knew the only reason why the other captain would be so distracted by Cyrus would be the same reasons he’s usually distracted by Cyrus. Because Cyrus is cute and he’s a raging homosexual.

TJ was showered and changed in ten minutes. He left the locker room at a quicker pace than normal. He pretended that it was to make sure Cyrus didn’t have to wait long, but he knew the main reason was to make sure the other captain didn’t try anything. Like asking him out in a polite and pleasant way. But when he reached the hall, he realized he was too late. Cyrus and the other player stood talking at the end of the corridor. The other team probably should’ve left already, but apparently, cute, quirky boys were a good reason to delay the trip back.

TJ slowly walked up to the pair, trying to act nonchalant, an expression he’d gotten pretty good at over the years of terrifying everyone in a thousand-foot radius. Except for Cyrus. And small children. And animals, surprisingly. Oh, and don’t forget his used-to-be nemesis, Buffy Driscoll. Plus, his sister. Oh, and-

“Teej!”, Cyrus excited call broke through the boy’s train of thought. TJ beamed at the smaller boy and was pleasantly surprised when Cyrus rushed over to him, leaving the other captain looking rather disappointed.

“Hey, Cy. Ready to go?”, TJ asked as he glanced at the other boy watching them. Before, the brown-eyed boy could answer, however, another voice interjected.

“Good game, Kippen”, the other captain said coming up to the two friends. The boy was about TJ’s height, but a bit skinnier, with brown hair and blue eyes freckles dotting his face. He was cute, in TJ’s professional gay opinion. Probably Cyrus’s type.

“Thanks, Marias”, the boy’s last name coming back to TJ. “Same for you.” Marais gave TJ a look. They both knew he hadn’t been playing his best. And they both knew the reason why. They tried to stare each other down for a bit before Marais turned toward the smaller boy who was looking between the two players.

“It was nice meeting you Cyrus”, he said. 

Cyrus smiled, “It was nice meeting you, too.”

The other captain nodded, realizing he had lost his chance at the boy as soon as TJ walked up. He nodded at TJ in one final acknowledgment before heading off, presumably towards his bus. The pair watched him leave before turning back toward each other. Now that he and Cyrus were alone, TJ visibly relaxed. He gave Cyrus a big smile before throwing his arm over the brunet’s shoulders. 

“So, milkshakes at the spoon?”, he asked. Cyrus beamed and nodded his head as they walked out of the school together.

—

When they were happily situated on their respective sides of a booth and had their customary basket of baby taters and milkshakes, TJ decided to address the thing that had been eating at him.

“So”, he began, stretching out and leaning back to make it seem like he wasn’t that interested. “What did Marais want?”

“Oh, he asked me out”, Cyrus answered, nonchalantly. If TJ had been drinking his milkshake, he would’ve choked.

“What?”, he asked in a strained voice.

“Yeah, he came up to me and said I was cute, and then he asked me out. What is it so strange that someone would want to go out with me?”, Cyrus said.

“No, I’m sure there are plenty of guys who want to ask you out”, TJ responded honestly. Me included, he thought. “It’s just–you didn’t say anything about going out with him.”

“I’m not. I said ‘no’.”

“You did? Why?”, TJ blanched. 

“I don’t like him like that. I like someone else”, Cyrus said, slightly nervous.

“Oh”, TJ replied, disappointed once again. “Who’s the lucky guy?”

Cyrus was quiet for a minute before taking a deep breath and looking up at TJ. “You.”

TJ sat shock still for a minute before his face broke out into the biggest smile his face could physically conjure up. “Me?”, he asked. Cyrus nodded, a small smile growing on his face. At this, TJ slid over to the other side of the booth and cupping the smaller boys face in his hands. He closed the distance between them and placed a soft kiss on the boy’s lips. When they pulled apart, they both wore huge grins.

“So, am I the person you like?”, Cyrus asked, teasing.

But TJ just nodded and seriously said, “It’s always been you, Underdog.” At this, Cyrus pulled him back into another small kiss.

The next time they played that team, Jefferson won 47-5. TJ celebrated by kissing his boyfriend.

summary: lowkey
body:
lowkey

maddys unpopular opinion literally no one asked for but im gonna say it anyways:

CATCH ME HOPING TJ ISNT BI, YOU WONT.

yes i know i say teegay kippen a lot but i want him to be bi. i just feel like its more interesting as a plot ( in terms of ahat devices you can use to show bisexuality on screen). and overall so helpful for kids to see in case they or someone they know is/are bisexual!

I KNOW IM GONNA GET PEOPLE SAYING HES GAY GET OVER IT BUT I STAND FIRM IN MY OPINION!!!!
